messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] geodesic newspaper dome
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you Ren for this,  I had no idea what a geodesic dome even was, I m anxious to look into doing it.  And I can t go to the conference so, thanks! Kelli
messages.messageBody:
Thank you Ren for this, I had no idea what a geodesic dome even was, I'm anxious to look into doing it. And I can't go to the conference so, thanks!
Kelli
starsuncloud@... wrote:In a message dated 10/4/02 11:05:36 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Can you describe how you do that? In enough detail that we could do it? Or
send us to someplace that has enough description of a method that you think
would really work?

How much time does it take for how big a dome? How many kids? How old and
how
hard is it really, to do it? >>

Whoa girl!! Too many questions this early in the A.M. :)
ok, I could probably describe it, but don't know if it would make sense....so
here's a link that will take you to some newspaper projects including the
dome.
2-3 kids can fit inside of it.
You have to make a bunch of newspaper logs, which is the time consuming part.
But it's really cool, and a great fort that is totally recyclable and
reusable, with totally free materials!!
And now I've given away my secret for the workshop, dang! You all better come
say hi anyway!! hehe

http://familyfun.go.com/crafts/cutpaste/feature/famf39newspaper/

Enjoy!!

Ren

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] geodesic newspaper dome
messages.msgSnippet: ... The family fun one is a little smaller and less complicated than the one we did.  Here s the url for the one we made, in case anyone wants to try it.
messages.messageBody:
> http://familyfun.go.com/crafts/cutpaste/feature/famf39newspaper/

The family fun one is a little smaller and less complicated than the one we
did. Here's the url for the one we made, in case anyone wants to try it.
http://www.yesmag.bc.ca/projects/geodesic.html
Tia
